intro: Andesanthus silvestris, commonly known as the Andean beauty, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
